title: Tour de France 2021 Standings after Stage 9
content:
General Classification / Yellow Jersey

Tadej Pogačar (UAE Team Emirates) retains the yellow jersey on stage 9 after he obliterated his GC rivals on stage 8. Ben O'Connor (AG2R Citroën) was the big winner on stage 9.

As well as stage victory in Tignes, the Australian jumped into second place in the general classification and is now a genuine contender to finish on the final podium in Paris. Rigoberto Uran (EF Education - Nippo) rises to third after Alexey Lutsenko (Astana Premier-Tech) lost time in Tignes.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Ben O'Connor +2:01
3. Rigoberto Uran +5:18
4. Jonas Vingegaard +5:32
5. Richard Carapaz +5:33
6. Enric Mas +5:47
7. Wilco Kelderman +5:58
8. Alexey Lutsenko +6:12
9. Guillaume Martin +7:02
10. David Gaudu +7:22

Tour de France 2021 Guide

Points Classification / Green Jersey

Mark Cavendish still leads the points classification for Deceuninck Quick-Step. Sonny Colbrelli and Michael Matthews have actively chased green jersey points at the intermediate sprints so far and that didn't change on stage nine. Phenomenally, Colbrelli finished third in Tignes after 4,500 metres of climbing, meaning he's now third whilst Matthews is second in the green jersey standings.

1. Mark Cavendish - 168 points
2. Michael Matthews - 130 points
3. Sonny Colbrelli - 121 points
4. Jasper Philipsen - 102 points
5. Julian Alaphilippe - 99 points

King of the Mountains Classification / Polka-Dot Jersey

Nairo Quintana gained the polka-dot jersey on stage nine of the Tour de France. He takes the jersey from Wout Poels who slips to third in the standings behind Mike Woods of Israel Start-Up Nation.

1. Nairo Quintana - 50 points
2. Michael Woods - 42 points
3. Wout Poels - 39 points
4. Ben O'Connor - 24 points
5. Sergio Higuita - 22 points

Young Rider's Classification / White Jersey

Tadej Pogačar leads the white jersey standings as well as the general classification. He leads Jonas Vingegaard, who will wear the jersey whilst Pogačar wears yellow. David Gaudu is third in the young rider's classification, though he lost time on stage nine.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +5:32
3. David Gaudu +7:22
4. Aurélien Paret-Peintre +11:54
5. Sergio Higuita +44:01

Team Classification

1. Bahrain Victorious
2. AG2R Citroën +18:04
3. Ineos Grenadiers +27:33
4. Astana - Premier Tech +34:01
5. EF Education - Nippo +42:38

Cover image: A.S.O./Pauline Ballet
author: Peter Stuart
